title: Soil and water supervisor rallies against reliance on synthetic chemicals in public parks - Port City Daily
summary: A pilot project at Olsen Park in New Hanover County is testing the efficiency of synthetic-free land care by avoiding using harmful pesticides and herbicides. The goal is to use compost and avoid chemicals to grow the soil on two of Olsen Park’s five ballfields. The city currently uses 13 herbicides and pesticides, and the county uses over 50, many of which are harmful to aquatic life, birds, and bees. Many of the chemicals are also listed as possible carcinogens by the EPA.
green_innovation: TRUE, the pilot program described in the article is an example of green innovation because it reduces negative environmental externalities (specifically the avoidance of toxic herbicides and pesticides that are harmful to ecosystems).
business_innovation: TRUE, the pilot project described in the article meets the criteria to be a business innovation because it is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes.
green_product: FALSE, the pilot program described in the article does not focus on a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, the pilot project described in the article is an example of a green process because it is a new or improved business process in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

title: Kohler Co. Outlines Strategy, Ambitions, and Progress in 2022 ESG Report - Contractor Magazine
summary: Kohler Co. released its 2022 ESG report highlighting progress in environmental sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion, and social impact. The company reduced GHG emissions by 16% and water intensity by 10%, and it invested in clean energy solutions. Kohler also expanded its product offerings to include more WaterSense-labeled products and launched a porcelain pour flush toilet for communities without access to piped water and electricity.
green_innovation: TRUE, Kohler Co.'s efforts to promote energy resiliency and resource conservation, as well as innovations in renewable and clean energy solutions, qualify as green innovations.
business_innovation: TRUE, Kohler Co.'s launch of a porcelain pour flush toilet (Kohler Rinse) for communities without access to piped water and electricity is a business innovation that addresses a social need.
green_product: TRUE, Kohler Co.'s porcelain pour flush toilet (Kohler Rinse) is a green product because it is designed to conserve water and improve sanitation in communities without access to piped water and electricity.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green process.

title: 'You don't have to be an activist': Here's how your simple actions can help protect the Earth - The Economic Times
summary: The article highlights personal actions individuals can take towards protecting the environment. Simple actions such as reducing waste, conserving water, adopting eco-friendly transportation, and mindful purchasing can significantly reduce environmental impact. By embracing collective responsibility, we can safeguard the planet and ensure a sustainable future.

title: NextGen Summit 2023 to strategize on R&D, Green Chemistry, and Sustainability Goals - Indian Chemical News
summary: The article discusses a panel discussion on R&D, Green Chemistry, and Sustainability Goals at the NextGen Chemicals & Petrochemicals Summit. The discussion will focus on the importance of green chemistry and sustainable development goals for businesses and society, and the challenges and opportunities in this area. Key discussion points include green chemistry and technology, sustainable product portfolio, green separation techniques, waste management and recycling, and green nanotechnologies.

title: Retail India News: Farmley Unveils ‘Healthy Ko Rakhe Healthy’ Campaign with Rahul Dravid - Indian Retailer
summary: The 'Scars are Beautiful' campaign by Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots aims to promote body positivity and self-love among women, particularly those who have undergone motherhood and have stretch marks as a result. The campaign features 11 mothers who proudly display their bodies and share their motherhood experiences, aiming to inspire other women to embrace their bodies and challenge societal perceptions of beauty. The campaign highlights that scars, both physical and emotional, are a symbol of strength, resilience, and the transformative power of motherhood.
